ygData.subject: Re: Crystal Numbers II
ygData.msgSnippet: Depends. Chords has a shorter range than Bellow. You also run the risk of ticking off something that might wander by with Chords. If you can isolate your
ygData.messageBody:
Depends. Chords has a shorter range than Bellow. You also run the risk of
ticking off something that might wander by with Chords. If you can isolate
your creature and stand up to it then Chords is the way to go. Bellow works
better in busy locations and against runners.

Good Journey,

Sineras (Cazic-Thule)

-----Original Message-----
From: Basil Eckert [mailto:athelas@...]
Sent: Monday, April 26, 1999 7:13 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] Re: Crystal Numbers II


From: Basil Eckert <athelas@...>

Hey!

This results are quite interesting. I am a level 15 bard and used to play
Jonthan's Warsong and Brusco's Bellow when soloing and Anthem de Arms /
Brusco's Bellow when fighting in team.
But now i'm not sure if this is still the best combination, cause my
bellow does 8 dmg and I can start it just 2 times until i have to restart
the
buff song. Maybe it would have more effect to switch between Chords of
Dissonance and the buff song cause the damage made by Chords until I have to
switch
back to the buff song would be higher than 16 points.
What do other bards think about that? What song combinations do you use
when fighting solo or in party?

Athelas
Tarew Marr
